descriptions.text: The computerized maintenance management system is one of the systems that play a critical role in the efficient use and optimization of the life of infrastructure facilities, the value of which is expressed in millions, the implementation of which takes many years, and the labor of hundreds of people in the background. What is CMMS? To answer the question, CMMS (Computerized maintenance management system), which also means computer-aided maintenance management systems, is the software that offers the most comprehensive solutions in the control and maintenance of a facility serving in different sectors from manufacturing to energy, from logistics to construction. The basic functions of CMMS, which dates back to the 1960s and is currently used as cloud-based and mobile; centralizing maintenance information in infrastructure facilities, facilitating processes and increasing efficiency.
How CMMS Works ?

CMMS is originally based on a database and records information about all physical and human resources within a facility in this database. In this way, it organizes all resources, from machines to tools, from materials to employees, within the framework of certain tasks and provides full coordination between processes.
What advantages does using CMMS provide ?
We can list the advantages of the effective use of CMMS in facilities as follows:
Increases efficiency and extends life.

With its data sharing approach, it harmonizes the activities at every point of the facility and at every stage of the operation and combines them in line with the same business objectives. It effectively reports the defects and malfunctions and allows them to be corrected. Cmms provides more efficient use of resources. It plays an active role in the efficient use of all resources, whether physical, such as machinery, equipment, vehicles, or human, such as employees. Thus, certifications of equipment or shifts of employees can be organized from a single dashboard.
Assets are registered.

Manufacturer, model, serial number, etc. of physical assets. It records all its capabilities in a wide range from features to their location in the facility, their performance and downtime, from maintenance manuals to warranties, and their integration into internet of things (IoT) applications. Established treatments are constantly standardized. information to the database; comes from sensors, usage statistics and other data of interest to maintenance teams. In this way, CMMS automates MRO inventory using artificial intelligence. It automates the processes of creating, locating and recalling inventory of materials used in maintenance and repair (MRO).
It provides effective management of orders by making workflows visible.

Helps maintenance teams easy access to assets by activating dashboards and reports. With this; It contributes to evaluating employee activities at every point of the facility, automating work orders, keeping records of planned and actual costs, and improving work order completion rates. It also creates healthier, safer and more environmentally friendly facilities. In line with the expectations of global and national authorities, regulations and customer demands, it establishes an early warning system for malfunctions and risks that will endanger both employee and environmental safety, ensures regular maintenance of assets, reports all realized problems and allows them to be corrected.
It mobilizes the workforce.
CMMS offers advantages and supports the integration of employees not only inside the facility but also outside the facility to common goals.
CMMS = long uptime = profitability

The reason for the existence of the maintenance managers and departments in the facilities is to ensure that the vehicles and equipment, which is the equivalent of a large and expensive investment, remain in operation for the longest time without failure. In other words, the assets that work the longest without fail are the most valuable, profitable and savings-friendly assets. Reliable and long working hours, on the other hand, create a ground where businesses that rely on reliable assets can easily turn to the demands of their customers.
What should be considered when choosing a CMMS?

When choosing a CMMS software, “access to support” is as important as functionality and technology. Service providers are required to provide training and support services before, during and after CMMS deployment. Another important factor is the integration of the selected CMMS into the existing systems in the facility. The effectiveness of CMMS, which can contain historical data, will increase. Finally, another important issue is whether to use CMMS as a service (SaaS) or on-prem (On-Prem). Obtaining this software as a service will mean that its features can be easily upgraded without compromising data quality and functionality, as well as quick trial and deployment. Incorporation will require the cooperation of IT and information security experts for optimization without data corruption.

title: What is Infrastructure Maintenance?
description: Infrastructure with the broadest definition; are facilities and systems developed to increase social welfare, quality of life and trade. bus...

descriptions.text: Infrastructure with the broadest definition; are facilities and systems developed to increase social welfare, quality of life and trade. Many investments from highways to airports, from oil and natural gas lines to production facilities, from warehouses to power plants, from hospitals to schools, telecommunications and even prisons are considered within the concept of infrastructure. Every year, hundreds of billions of dollars of infrastructure investments are made in the world, sometimes in partnership with the public, sometimes the private sector, and sometimes both. However, the need for infrastructure investments in many parts of the world, especially in developing countries, is still huge. According to the World Economic Forum data, with the current investment pace, the world will have an infrastructure deficit of 15 trillion dollars by 2040. On the other hand; Countries that successfully build or renew their infrastructures are rapidly integrating into their trade networks and developing rapidly with a more dynamic economy and social welfare. In the background of infrastructure investments, there is a large amount of capital, planning ability, technological know-how and the mobilization of the workforce. In this respect, each infrastructure investment is very valuable, and the way to make their lifespan as long as possible is in terms of effective 'infrastructure'.
What is Public infrastructure and Private infrastructure?

It is traditionally believed that infrastructure investments are the responsibility of governments. Indeed, with urbanization, public administrations; It has implemented many infrastructure investments in areas such as transportation, energy, sanitation, telecommunication, education, health and sports. Taxes collected from the public are active in the financing of public infrastructure. The service will return to the public again. Therefore, taxes should be evaluated in the best possible investment. The private sector has undertaken investments in areas such as production facilities, warehouses, retail and office areas for profit maximization. In recent years, a model combining the public-private partnership (PPP) and infrastructure investments with the dynamism of the private sector has been designed, and infrastructure investments in many areas from health to transportation, from renewable energy to telecommunication have begun to be met.
Why is infrastructure maintenance needed?

“Sustainability” is more important than ever in terms of social development. This purpose necessitates the uninterrupted service of infrastructures. Regardless of its purpose and by whichever parties, infrastructures that are regularly maintained will have a longer life, be used more effectively and touch the lives of many people.
Facilitating solution for the maintenance of infrastructures: Maintenance management software (CMMS)

As infrastructures become more technologically complex, their maintenance becomes more difficult and, of course, the risks increase. Dynamic, real-time and data-driven maintenance will reduce these risks and facilitate infrastructure maintenance. Modern maintenance management software (CMMS) is the most effective of the current tools in realizing this purpose.
Take a new approach to infrastructure maintenance with CMMS.
Control data centrally.

Trying to manually monitor and manage data in digitizing infrastructure facilities is now a dream. Simple spreadsheets kept in a computer environment are too simple for these complex facilities and bring data loss risks. A competent CMMS software; will record all resources in the database, integrate the data and channel the maintenance team to the right target based on centralized data.
Shift to a planned and pro-active care paradigm.

The most effective way to reduce maintenance costs today is to detect risks before they materialize and to prevent them before they become much more costly. A competent CMMS will ensure that a planned and pro-active maintenance program is established and will lead the maintenance team directly to the target. The program may contain the following information:
All maintenance directives
Customizable checklists
All relevant tools and materials
Possible security risks
Digital diagram, operation and maintenance guides
Interactive facility maps and floor plans
Access to the mobile application 24/7.

The ability to access the mobile application at any time with barcode scanning provided by a competent CMMS is a critical tool to ensure that the maintenance team who goes to the problem area does not interrupt their communication with the center and does not cause distance-related costs. Thanks to the mobile application, the team will be able to upload data and images directly to the system and enable the center to examine the problem with visual evidence.

subTitle: PERIODIC MAINTENANCE MANAGEMENT
title: What is Condition Based Maintenance (CBM)?
description: Traditional preventive maintenance strategies used to prevent potential failures in an infrastructure often involve unnecessary asset maintenance.

descriptions.text: Traditional preventive maintenance strategies used to prevent potential failures in an infrastructure often result in unnecessary asset maintenance, which triggers unpredictable equipment failures and increases costs. Condition-based maintenance (CBM) has two main purposes;
Detection of possible malfunction of the equipment
Intervention to prevent the growth of this malfunction and the complete disruption of the system
Condition based maintenance

Thanks to this, the performance of infrastructure-critical systems can be monitored in real time, and wear and malfunctions that may occur in moving components can be detected. Thanks to CBM, the maintenance of assets can be planned much more effectively. The critical element here is “what failures is my presence likely to cause?” is the question. Condition-based maintenance is often confused with predictive or predictive maintenance (PdM). In fact, PdM is like an upgraded version of CBM. It monitors data from sensors using predictive analysis and algorithms.
How Does Condition Based Care Work?

For CBM applications in infrastructure, sensors and equipment are needed to monitor all assets. Thanks to the sensors, it will be possible to reach real-time information about the health of the assets. This will also lead to more robust and data-driven information on when an asset should be serviced. For example; an operationally critical compressor, fan, HVAC system, etc. Let's put a vibration sensor on it. As the vibrations related to extreme hot, cold, fast and slow conditions increase, information reaches the maintenance team and the necessary situation for intervention becomes “formed”.
Advantages of Condition Based Care
The advantages of condition-based maintenance are listed as follows;
Increases efficiency and extends service life.
It minimizes unplanned disruptions.
It reduces unnecessary maintenance.
It puts an end to unnecessary spare and stock parts costs.
It allows remote monitoring.
Disadvantages of Condition Based Care
So what are the disadvantages of this maintenance strategy? Let's review it if you wish.
For the effectiveness of the application, it is necessary to train the teams.
Requires sensor infrastructure.
Incurs initial investment cost.
It allows remote monitoring.
Integration issues may occur as there is data access from multiple sources.
Steps of Condition Based Maintenance Strategy
There are several stages involved in implementing an effective condition-based maintenance strategy in an infrastructure. Let's take a look at them together...
Focus on Critical Assets

Focus should be on the assets most likely to cause a malfunction. Considering the initial investment cost for sensor systems, the right assets should be selected where disruption of operations will result in the highest costs.
Choose the Right Technology
Even the slightest vibration should not be ignored in order to monitor the beings towards their health. For this reason, the right technology should be preferred in the first sensor investment.
Leverage the Power of Data

Each of the vibrations from the sensors is transformed into data to build an accurate maintenance strategy. This data not only allows real-time monitoring, but also provides powerful insights into future problems.
Apply for a Digital Solution

A digital solution should be resorted to in order to collect all the data from the sensors on a single platform and to avoid possible integration problems. A competent CMMS application is also an important aid for decision makers who consider condition-based maintenance to be the most appropriate strategy for their infrastructure. Thanks to the CMMS, this data will be able to be transformed into meaningful reports and dashboards.
Engage Key Performance Indicators

Key performance indicators, or KPIs, are metrics that evaluate critical factors for the success of an operation. KPIs are critical in a condition-based maintenance strategy. CMMS software is a very important aid for maintenance professionals to create the required KPIs. Comparing and tracking data in line with KPIs; It will also provide a key contribution to determining where the operations are within the business objectives.

subTitle: PERIODIC MAINTENANCE MANAGEMENT
title: What is Periodic Maintenance?
description: Unexpected failures in assets are one of the most troublesome issues for infrastructures. A certain warranty and insurance cover..

descriptions.text: Unexpected failures in assets are one of the most troublesome issues for infrastructures. Even if they are covered by a specific warranty and insurance, equipment failures result in “invaluable” losses that exceed repair costs. Some or all of these results include the shutdown of a part or all of the facility, failure to keep up with the deadlines, and of course, in a worse scenario, customer and market losses.
Periodic maintenance

It is a maintenance strategy based on performing the maintenance of assets at regular intervals before an infrastructure facility fails. In this respect, periodic maintenance; It is a precautionary measure to remove the emergency maintenance developed for events such as fire, gas leak, flood from the agenda.
Periodic maintenance types
Periodic maintenance types are discussed under three headings. Each company can choose the method that is most suitable for them, based on their dissimilar needs.
Takvim odaklı bakım:
It is the type of periodic maintenance that is widely used; It is activated in periods such as quarter, month, year.
Usage-oriented maintenance:
It is a maintenance type developed based on the fact that the assets have a certain operating limit (hour, distance, cycle, etc.).
Predictive maintenance:
It is a type of periodic maintenance that predicts malfunctions based on historical data, especially the mean time at which malfunctions occur (MTBF).
Periodic maintenance examples

While it varies for each industry and facility, some periodic maintenance patterns are the same for many infrastructures. Changing filters, lubricants, belts and cleaning heating-cooling systems are the first examples that come to mind.
Advantages of periodic maintenance
Periodic maintenance in infrastructure facilities offers many advantages. Let's take a brief look at these:
Reduces downtime
It reduces the downtime and downtime of assets by up to 70%, keeping assets dynamic and increasing productivity.
Lowers overall costs

It reduces costs with data-driven and preventive touches, without a possible and potentially devastating “major breakdown” in machinery, vehicles and systems. The second dimension, which reduces the costs, is the advantages arising from the correct guidance of the maintenance teams.
Extends service life

Controlling the assets, in particular, the infrastructure in general, and developing them with real-time interventions will extend the life of the entire system. This will have positive consequences for the final beneficiaries, whether public or private.
Prepares maintenance teams for adverse scenarios

Despite everything, “emergencies” can develop in infrastructures. However, teams experienced in periodic maintenance now have the right information and experience to fix the problem as soon as possible.
Disadvantages of periodic maintenance
The use of periodic maintenance should be limited and “goal-oriented”. If this is not approached;
Unexpected malfunctions may occur.
Instrumentalizing periodic maintenance may increase the risk of asset deterioration, resulting in more maintenance.
It wastes resources.
Frequent repetitive maintenance wastes energy, time and financial resources, especially maintenance teams. Managing periodic maintenance with a CMMS software will eliminate all these disadvantages.
Use of CMMS in periodic maintenance
Periodic maintenance strategies implemented with a competent CMMS application in the infrastructure facilities of periodic maintenance consist of the following phases:
The order set is organized for periodic maintenance, and its support with a competent CMMS application offers many advantages.
The job is entered into the system by targeting a specific calendar and given priority.
The maintenance team receives and fulfills its “duty” notification through the system
The work order is fulfilled, reported and recorded in the database.
Every completed task is analyzed and used in system optimization
Cost-friendly solution: CMMS

Although making use of CMMS software for periodic maintenance is frightening for companies in terms of cost, it is not an argument that reflects this reality. CMMS guarantees high return on investment in a short time as an early warning system as well as accurate monitoring and control for the employer. In other words, your investment returns quickly to you. In short, if any or more of your assets that keep your infrastructure afloat, even for a few hours, will disrupt your plans. It is very difficult for these companies to take, and these risks can be minimized with a competent CMMS software. In this article, What is Periodic Maintenance? We answered the question. subTitle: BLOG
title: IoT and New Trends in Manufacturing
description: All over the world, production processes are going through a rapid transformation. IoT is one of the main tools of this transformation. IoT in manufacturing, a...

descriptions.text: All over the world, production processes are going through a rapid transformation. IoT is one of the main tools of this transformation. In manufacturing, IoT is the interconnection of all assets within a facility via sensors and internet connectivity, and is the key to the transition to the “smart and talking manufacturing facilities” paradigm. The IoT applications market, which is around 200 billion dollars in the global manufacturing industry, is expected to increase to 1.5 trillion dollars by 2030. This marks massive growth compared to many industries. Moreover, this transformation is not only limited to the manufacturing industry, but it seems that it will return as added value to the global economy with the multiplier effect that implements a holistic efficiency strategy.
Advantages of Iot in Production
There are many advantages of using IoT in production. To summarize briefly;
Improved and secure facilities
Reliable products with effective quality control mechanisms
Instant monitoring of production flow
Energy saving and reduced waste
Smart packaging
Effective supply chain
Flexible responses to market demands
Efficiency and reduced costs
New customer segments
Inventory management
Ability to create digital twins
Effective infrastructure maintenance

Manufacturers who realize the potential of IoT and benefit from the power of data not only make their production more efficient and cost-friendly; It can also reach vertical business models and new revenue streams. IoT is a true friend for strategies for facilities to establish a lifelong relationship with the end user, instead of the business models that no longer end with distributors or dealerships.
What are the IoT Trends in Manufacturing?
So what will be the trends that shape IoT processes in production?
5G Technology

One of the most talked about topics of the technological revolution is 5G technology. While it is predicted that 85% of operator investments to be made until 2025 will be 5G investments, it is estimated that this technology will generate an added value of $3.8 trillion by 2035. It is expected that the data dynamism and flexibility to be provided by 5G will be reflected in the production facilities, and data transfer between assets will become much faster and safer.
Remote Monitoring

One of the flexibility that the pandemic has brought to the world is the ability to maintain production even from a distance. It is of great importance to be able to connect to the facilities at the desired time and manner. The fact that maintenance teams can predict malfunctions remotely through sensors and spend much less time and energy for intervention means effective management of costs in the production area.
Predictive Maintenance

Manufacturers face great competition. Delivery times have become an important topic in this competition, and unplanned stoppages in machine lines are becoming a factor that weakens competitiveness. IoT-based predictive maintenance strategies are critical in solving these problems. The process works as follows; Data from connected entities is transferred to an artificial intelligence-based software. In this way, any malfunction that may occur in the asset network can be predicted on a data-based basis before it occurs. This means higher efficiency and lower costs. According to research, the savings that can be achieved in production facilities around the world with predictive maintenance have the potential to reach 250-700 billion dollars. In recent years, companies have reached a significant level of awareness about the benefits of the predictive maintenance strategy. As a matter of fact, the predictive maintenance segment in the global industrial Iot market, accounting for 27 percent of the total turnover, is proof of this, according to the Precedence Research analysis.
Using artificial intelligence in Predictive Maintenance

Behind this success of the predictive maintenance approach is the doubtful use of artificial intelligence. With machine learning, data can be analyzed much more effectively and precisely, and manufacturers have the opportunity to reach many opportunities. In summary; It is clear that manufacturers who want to achieve efficiency and competitiveness will include more IoT-based predictive maintenance applications in their facilities in the future.

description: Today, modern production and management techniques applied in businesses are based on customer demands. Expectations of customers on products and services...

descriptions.text: Today, modern production and management techniques applied in businesses are based on customer demands. Since the expectations of the customers on the product and service are constantly increasing, this situation causes the production systems of the enterprises to become increasingly complex and complicated. The increasing complexity of production systems makes it difficult to maintain a certain efficiency standard and causes errors in production processes.

While waiting for the planned production to be made in a production line, various problems such as malfunctions may occur and these problems can upset the production plans with the interruptions they create. This situation is a nightmare for a business and therefore maintenance activities in businesses are of critical importance. Maintenance activities must be carried out and managed in a conscious and planned manner for certain purposes. Maintenance is the whole of the activities carried out to maintain the functions of the equipment and systems in the enterprise at the highest performance. In order for businesses to fulfill their main responsibilities, they need to ensure the continuity of their equipment and systems, not to hinder their mass production, and to keep the product quality high. In order to ensure the continuity of the operating systems, the search for taking precautions before the failure occurs and reducing the frequency of failure has brought new approaches to maintenance and the concept of Total Productive Maintenance (TVB) has emerged.

Total efficient maintenance includes equipment tracking, failure tracking, part life and spare part analysis, and predetermining the failure points of the systems, determining and implementing the necessary actions in accordance with the maintenance plans. The aim is to prevent malfunctions that may occur by focusing on maintenance activities and to minimize the interruptions of work flows due to malfunctions.

Total Productive Maintenance is the measurement and comparison of selected parameters with predetermined limit values using graphical trends in order to detect, analyze and correct malfunctions in machinery and equipment before they become problematic. The approach used is to predict the future status of machinery and equipment by monitoring their current and past conditions.
Research shows that average maintenance costs can be reduced by up to 50% at the company level that implements TVB.

It is a fact that today's competitive conditions have changed a lot compared to the past. The ability of businesses to maintain or even increase their profitability brings with it a very good strategic planning and analysis of business processes. Under these conditions, reducing maintenance costs without disrupting production and service is an unmissable opportunity for a business. This is the main point that makes Total Productive Maintenance important.
Features of Total Productive Care
The eight pillars of TVB mostly focus on precautionary and preventive techniques to improve equipment reliability.
Autonomous maintenance
Operators using all their senses to help identify causes of losses.
Focused Improvement:
Scientific approach to problem solving to eliminate losses in the factory.
Planned Maintenance:
Professional maintenance activities performed by trained mechanics and engineers.
Quality management
Scientific and statistical approach to identify defects and eliminate their causes.
Early Equipment Management:
Scientific presentation of equipment and design concepts that eliminate losses and facilitate efficient production without defect.
Education and Training
Support for the continuous improvement of the knowledge of all employees and management
Administrative Office TVB:

Using TVB tools to improve all support aspects of a manufacturing facility, including production planning, materials management, and information flow, as well as boosting the morale of individuals and rewarding deserving employees for boosting their morale.
Safe Environmental Conditions

subTitle: FAULT MANAGEMENT
title: Failure Modes and Effects Analysis
description: A product development and operations management process that classifies faults by probability and similarity to analyze potential failure modes of a system.

descriptions.text: Failure modes and effects analysis; It is a product development and operations management procedure that categorizes faults according to their probability and similarity in order to analyze potential failure modes of a system. A successful defect type analysis job helps identify defect types based on past experience of similar products or processes. It ensures that these errors are eliminated from the system with minimum resource usage and effort, while reducing development time and cost. Although it is generally used in various stages of products in the production sector, its usage area has also increased in the service sector.

The basic idea of FMEA is to prevent faults by recognizing them early and to evaluate the possible causes of faults from the design stage, instead of detecting and correcting the fault later (error management). In this way, control and error costs and even customer costs (customer) that otherwise occur during the production phase can be avoided and the total costs can be reduced. With a systematic approach and the information coming from this approach, the repetition of design errors in new products and processes is prevented.

After a process is ready for production or in a production process, the important thing is to ensure the reliability of the process or product. Reliability is an important feature of products or processes. At the same time, it is a factor that has a great impact on providing customer satisfaction. Customers want the product they use to have a long service life and at the same time to be a trouble-free process. Therefore, the step to be taken to ensure the reliability of the product or process; It is to carry out a risk analysis that can determine the types of errors that may arise and their effects on the product or process, and to control the reliability of a process to be established or established.

title: Reliability-Centered Maintenance Approach
description: As a result of the studies on the reliability of complex machines and devices in the USA in the 1960s, the 'Reliability Centered...

descriptions.text: As a result of the studies on the reliability of complex machines and devices in the USA in the 1960s, the foundations of the 'Reliability Centered Maintenance' strategy were laid in the aviation industry. RCM, which was used only in the aviation industry at the beginning, has started to be used in industrial areas such as nuclear power plants, petrochemical facilities, pipelines, where safety is at the forefront. Today, the usage area of RCM is expanding rapidly. RCM searches for and implements the most appropriate combination of machine condition-based maintenance (Predictive Maintenance), uptime-based periodic maintenance, and post-failure maintenance strategies.

RCM’nin tanımını, bakım kavramı tanımıyla birlikte ele almak gerekir. Bakım, fiziksel varlıkların yapmaları gereken işleri sürdürmeyi sağlamak ve güvence altına almak üzere yapılan çalışmalar bütünüdür. Bu tanım doğrultusunda RCM, herhangi bir fiziksel varlığın kendi çalışma sistemi içerisinde bakım gereksinimlerinin belirlenmesini sağlayan süreçtir. RCM, ekipmanın işlevselliği, arıza modları ve etkileri analizi ve arıza sonuçlarının değerlendirilmesi ile gerekli bakım işlemlerinin ve bu işlemlerin yapılması gereken zaman aralıklarının belirlendiği yöntem bilimdir.

It is seen that the number of studies on Reliability Centered Maintenance has increased especially in the last ten years. It is possible to increase the equipment life cycle within the enterprise with the understanding of RCM, which has applications at different scales in different fields, especially in the manufacturing sector. VİDA Maintenance Management Application also provides services to businesses by following machine and equipment maintenance with “Predictive Maintenance” and “Periodic Maintenance” modes in the light of RCM method.
